intro: Solidago carpathica, commonly known as Carpathian goldenrod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, branching stems. The plant features lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Solidago carpathica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
